title: [Self-Directed] Integration Strategy for Digital Platforms and Traditional Materials in Medical Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Medical Terminology and Understanding of Pharmacological Concepts
context.additional_context: Requirement for blended learning design combining digital platforms and textbooks in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments.

learning_goals: Learners can select digital platforms or traditional materials as needed to explain pharmacology concepts with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can integrate digital resources (images/tables) and textbook content in PBL projects to present clinical application cases three or more times.
Learners can develop and be evaluated on accessibility strategies for content with over 90% accessibility in smartphone environments.

resources: Core pharmacology textbook (e.g., Katzung & Trevor's Pharmacology)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
